titles: Proposals humbly offer'd to the consideration of the honourable House of Commons, for laying a poll-tax on all horses, mares, geldings, &c. for one year and a poundage-tax on all horses, mares, geldings, &c. that shall be bought or sold in England. Also an annual imposition or duty on all weights and measures whatsoever; as likewise on all shopkeepers and tradesmen.
author: Smith, John, writer on taxation.
notes: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
keywords: Horses --  Taxation --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Poll tax --  England --  Early works to 1800.
